ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great class! Take it, its a lot of fun and not too much work.

Yes -- most people have a fairly good idea of what they're getting into and get a lot out of it. Of course, it's a fair amount of work - finding interesting places to shoot and working with the digital images takes time. And art classes themselves take more class time. But overall I found this course to be only a little bit more intense than my other classes. If you're willing to put the time in, you will gain familiarity with a digital camera and with photoshop .. and maybe even become a better artist!

I would recommend digital photography as Cr/D, otherwise it can be a lot of pressure if you're not artistic and feel like you don't know what you're doing. Overall, I enjoyed it a lot (taking it Cr/D) and definitely thought my skills improved

You'll learn the basics of digital photography and develop your own artistic vision. You will definitely improve as a photographer by the end of the class, even if you think you are already pretty knowledgeable about photography. It is a decent amount of work, between shooting and printing. I would absolutely recommend the class, especially with Professor Maida, who is a fantastic professor.

If you have never touched a DSLR camera before, this course is a good introduction to the medium, and you will definitely see improvement in your camerawork over the semester. It is a big time commitment, though, so be prepared to spend long hours each week shooting and editing. If you have other major commitments or priorities, then I would probably recommend taking this course at another time unless you take it Credit/D.
Definitely take it. one of the best classes at yale. You learn a ton - in an enjoyable way. you'll walk away with a new skill and hobby; i haven't put my camera down since.
